alert.note: Alert for Kittson (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:26AM CDT until March 29 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Flooding continues on the Red River at Fargo/Moorhead and points northward (with the exception of Halstad). Fargo/Moorhead is at or near crest today (Sunday) with Grand Forks/East Grand Forks expected to crest late Monday or early Tuesday...both in the minor flood category. Oslo will continue to see moderate flooding with minor flooding at Drayton and Pembina to begin shortly as river levels rise at these locations. All North Dakota tributaries remain below flood stage. However, the Sheyenne River at the West Fargo diversion may fluctuate a bit due to some minor ice jamming. On the Minnesota side, both the Buffalo River at Dilworth and Two Rivers river at Hallock will continue to see minor flooding for the next few days while river levels continue to recede. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Two Rivers River near Hallock. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 802.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Hallock Dam spillway at Gilbert Park closed to the public. Culverts with flappers are checked. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 797.1 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 802.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
